api/BOOSEInterpreter.ArrayCommand.html.title: Class ArrayCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.ArrayCommand.html.summary: Class ArrayCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The ArrayCommand class is implemented to handle the creation and initialization of arrays. Support is provided for both integer and real number arrays, including single and multi-dimensional definitions. public class ArrayCommand : ICommand Inheritance object ArrayCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The array command is executed to parse the provided arguments and instantiate the requested array. The resulting array object is stored within the shared variables dictionary for subsequent access. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method but is not utilized for array creation. variables Dictionary<string, object> The global variable storage is accessed to store the newly created array instance. args string[] The command arguments are processed to determine the array type, name, and dimensions. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the argument count is insufficient or if an unsupported array type is specified.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.BOOSEException.html.title: Class BOOSEException | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.BOOSEException.html.summary: Class BOOSEException Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The BOOSEException class is implemented to handle application-specific errors within the BOOSE Interpreter. It is derived from the standard Exception class to provide custom error messages and handling. public class BOOSEException : Exception, ISerializable Inheritance object Exception BOOSEException Implements ISerializable Inherited Members Exception.GetBaseException() Exception.GetType() Exception.ToString() Exception.Data Exception.HelpLink Exception.HResult Exception.InnerException Exception.Message Exception.Source Exception.StackTrace Exception.TargetSite Exception.SerializeObjectState object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors BOOSEException() A new instance of the BOOSEException class is initialized with default properties. public BOOSEException() BOOSEException(string) A new instance of the BOOSEException class is initialized with a specific error message. public BOOSEException(string message) Parameters message string The message that describes the error. BOOSEException(string, Exception) A new instance of the BOOSEException class is initialized with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception. public BOOSEException(string message, Exception inner) Parameters message string The error message that explains the reason for the exception. inner Exception The exception that is the cause of the current exception, or a null reference if no inner exception is specified.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.BaseCommand.html.title: Class BaseCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.BaseCommand.html.summary: Class BaseCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The BaseCommand abstract class is implemented to provide shared functionality across specific command implementations. A common expression evaluator and helper methods are exposed to derived classes to facilitate argument processing. public abstract class BaseCommand : ICommand Inheritance object BaseCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Fields evaluator A static instance of the ExpressionEvaluator is maintained to ensure consistent expression parsing across all commands. protected static ExpressionEvaluator evaluator Field Value ExpressionEvaluator Methods EvaluateInt(string, Dictionary<string, object>) An argument string is evaluated and converted into an integer value. The expression evaluator is utilized to resolve variable references or mathematical expressions contained within the argument. protected int EvaluateInt(string arg, Dictionary<string, object> variables) Parameters arg string The argument string is processed. variables Dictionary<string, object> The current variable state is referenced during evaluation. Returns int The evaluated result is returned as an integer. Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command execution logic is defined by the derived class. The method is called to perform the specific action associated with the command using the provided canvas and variable context. public abstract void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is targeted for rendering operations. variables Dictionary<string, object> The scope of variables is provided for parameter evaluation. args string[] The arguments for the command are supplied as a string array.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.BooleanCommand.html.title: Class BooleanCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.BooleanCommand.html.summary: Class BooleanCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The BooleanCommand class is implemented to facilitate the creation and assignment of boolean variables. Logical expressions are evaluated, and the resulting truth values are stored within the application state for later use. public class BooleanCommand : ICommand Inheritance object BooleanCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to parse the provided arguments and establish the boolean variable. The expression is isolated, evaluated using the expression evaluator, and the result is cast to a boolean before being stored in the variable dictionary. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method but is not required for boolean variable assignment. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed to store the newly defined boolean value. args string[] The array of command arguments is processed to extract the variable name and the expression to be evaluated. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the syntax is incorrect or if the evaluated result cannot be converted to a boolean value.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.CallCommand.html.title: Class CallCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.CallCommand.html.summary: Class CallCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The CallCommand class is implemented to facilitate the invocation of user-defined methods. Parameters are parsed, evaluated, and passed to the method body for execution within a local variable scope. public class CallCommand : ICommand Inheritance object CallCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors CallCommand(Parser) A new instance of the CallCommand class is initialized with a reference to the Parser. public CallCommand(Parser parser) Parameters parser Parser The Parser instance is provided to allow access to method definitions and execution context. Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to call a specific method with the provided arguments. The method definition is retrieved, arguments are evaluated and mapped to parameters, and the method body is executed. Return values are captured and stored in the global variable scope if applicable. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method execution context. variables Dictionary<string, object> The global variable dictionary is accessed for argument evaluation and return value storage. args string[] The command arguments are processed to identify the method name and parameters. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the method is not found, or if there is a mismatch in the number of arguments provided.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.CastCommand.html.title: Class CastCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.CastCommand.html.summary: Class CastCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The CastCommand class is implemented to handle variable type casting. Real number values are converted into integers and stored in destination variables. public class CastCommand : ICommand Inheritance object CastCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to perform the casting operation. The source variable is retrieved and its real value is converted to an integer, which is then assigned to the destination variable. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method execution context. variables Dictionary<string, object> The global variable dictionary is accessed to retrieve source values and update destination variables. args string[] The command arguments are parsed to identify the source and destination variables. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the source variable does not exist in the variable dictionary.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.CircleCommand.html.title: Class CircleCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.CircleCommand.html.summary: Class CircleCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The CircleCommand class is implemented to facilitate the drawing of circles on the canvas. The radius expression is evaluated, and the corresponding drawing operation is invoked. public class CircleCommand : ICommand Inheritance object CircleCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to draw a circle. The arguments are joined and evaluated to determine the radius, which is then passed to the canvas for rendering. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is targeted for the drawing operation. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed to evaluate the radius expression. args string[] The arguments are processed to extract the radius parameter. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the radius parameter is not provided.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.CommandFactory.html.title: Class CommandFactory | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.CommandFactory.html.summary: Class CommandFactory Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The CommandFactory class is implemented to manage the creation and retrieval of command objects. The Factory design pattern is utilized to instantiate commands based on string identifiers, ensuring a decoupled architecture. The Singleton pattern is applied to ensure a single instance of the factory manages command generation throughout the application lifecycle. public class CommandFactory Inheritance object CommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods GetCommand(string) The command corresponding to the specified name is retrieved. This method serves as a wrapper for the MakeCommand method. public ICommand GetCommand(string commandName) Parameters commandName string The name of the command to retrieve. Returns ICommand The requested ICommand object is returned. HasCommand(string) Checks are performed to determine if a command with the specified name exists within the factory. public bool HasCommand(string commandName) Parameters commandName string The name of the command to verify. Returns bool True is returned if the command exists; otherwise, false is returned. Instance(Parser) The singleton instance of the CommandFactory is retrieved. If the instance does not exist, it is created in a thread-safe manner. public static CommandFactory Instance(Parser parser = null) Parameters parser Parser The parser instance is provided to facilitate command initialization where necessary. Returns CommandFactory The unique instance of the CommandFactory is returned. MakeCommand(string) A command object is instantiated based on the provided command type string. The command string is normalized, and the corresponding command object is retrieved from the registry. public ICommand MakeCommand(string commandType) Parameters commandType string The string identifier for the requested command type. Returns ICommand The ICommand implementation corresponding to the specified type is returned. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the requested command type is not recognized by the factory.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.CommandHelper.html.summary: Class CommandHelper Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The CommandHelper class is implemented to provide utility methods for command execution. Common operations such as argument evaluation are centralized to ensure consistency and reduce code duplication. public static class CommandHelper Inheritance object CommandHelper Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods EvaluateInt(string, Dictionary<string, object>) An argument string is evaluated and returned as an integer. The expression evaluator is used to process the argument within the context of the provided variables. public static int EvaluateInt(string arg, Dictionary<string, object> variables) Parameters arg string The argument string to be evaluated. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed to resolve variable references. Returns int The evaluated result is returned as a 32-bit signed integer.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.DrawToCommand.html.title: Class DrawToCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.DrawToCommand.html.summary: Class DrawToCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The DrawToCommand class is implemented to handle drawing lines to specific coordinates. The pen is moved from its current position to the specified target coordinates, creating a line on the canvas. public class DrawToCommand : ICommand Inheritance object DrawToCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to draw a line to the target coordinates. The arguments are parsed to extract the x and y coordinates, which are then evaluated and passed to the canvas drawing method. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is targeted for the line drawing operation. variables Dictionary<string, object> The variable dictionary is accessed to evaluate coordinate expressions. args string[] The command arguments are processed to determine the destination coordinates. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the incorrect number of parameters is provided.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.DrawingCanvas.html.title: Class DrawingCanvas | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.DrawingCanvas.html.summary: Class DrawingCanvas Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The DrawingCanvas class is used to perform drawing operations on a bitmap surface. It extends the functionality of the BOOSE.Canvas class to support specific shapes and text rendering using GDI+. public class DrawingCanvas : Canvas, ICanvas Inheritance object Canvas DrawingCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members Canvas.background_colour Canvas.Reset() Canvas.Set(int, int) Canvas.Xpos Canvas.Ypos object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors DrawingCanvas(PictureBox) A new instance of the DrawingCanvas class is initialized. The graphics context is created from the provided PictureBox, and the default pen colour is set to Red. public DrawingCanvas(PictureBox outputCanvas) Parameters outputCanvas PictureBox The PictureBox control where the output is displayed. Properties PenColour The current colour of the pen is retrieved or set. public override object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object Methods Circle(int, bool) A circle is drawn centered at the current pen position. If filling is enabled, the circle is filled with the current pen colour. public override void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle. filled bool A boolean indicating if the circle is filled. Clear() The canvas is cleared and reset to a white background. The pen colour is reset to the default Red. public override void Clear() ClearCanvas() The Clear method is called to clear the canvas. public void ClearCanvas() DrawCircle(int) A circle is drawn using the current fill state settings. public void DrawCircle(int radius) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle. DrawRectangle(int, int) A rectangle is drawn using the current fill state settings. public void DrawRectangle(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle. height int The height of the rectangle. DrawTo(int, int) A line is drawn from the current position to the specified coordinates. The canvas is refreshed to display the change. public override void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The x-coordinate of the destination. y int The y-coordinate of the destination. GetCurrentPosition() The current position of the pen is retrieved as a Point object. public Point GetCurrentPosition() Returns Point A Point representing the current X and Y coordinates. MoveTo(int, int) The pen is moved to the specified coordinates without drawing a line. public override void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The target x-coordinate. y int The target y-coordinate. Rect(int, int, bool) A rectangle is drawn by calling the Rectangle method. public override void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle. height int The height of the rectangle. filled bool A boolean indicating if the rectangle is filled. Rectangle(int, int, bool) A rectangle is drawn at the current pen position. If filling is enabled, the rectangle is filled with the current pen colour. public override void Rectangle(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle. height int The height of the rectangle. filled bool A boolean indicating if the rectangle is filled. Refresh() The PictureBox is invalidated to force a repaint of the canvas. public void Refresh() SetColour(int, int, int) The pen colour is set using specific RGB values. public override void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int The red component of the colour (0-255). green int The green component of the colour (0-255). blue int The blue component of the colour (0-255). SetFill(bool) The fill state is set to determine if shapes are filled or outlined. public void SetFill(bool state) Parameters state bool The boolean state to set (true for filled, false for outline). SetPenColour(Color) The pen colour is set to the specified Color object. public void SetPenColour(Color color) Parameters color Color The colour to be applied to the pen. Tri(int, int) A triangle is drawn based on the specified width and height. The triangle is defined by three points calculated from the current position. public override void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the triangle base. height int The height of the triangle. WriteText(string) Text is written at the current pen position. The text is rendered using a standard Sans Serif font. public override void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The string of text to be written. getBitmap() The underlying bitmap image is retrieved from the canvas. public override object getBitmap() Returns object The Bitmap object representing the canvas content.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.ExpressionEvaluator.title: Class ExpressionEvaluator | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.ExpressionEvaluator.summary: Class ExpressionEvaluator Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The ExpressionEvaluator class is implemented to process and evaluate mathematical and logical expressions. A DataTable is utilized for numerical computation, and custom logic is applied for string operations and boolean comparisons. public class ExpressionEvaluator Inheritance object ExpressionEvaluator Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Evaluate(string, Dictionary<string, object>) An expression string is evaluated within the context of the provided variables. The expression is analyzed to determine if it involves string concatenation, logical operations, or numerical computation. Variable references are resolved before the final evaluation is performed. public object Evaluate(string expression, Dictionary<string, object> variables) Parameters expression string The expression string to be evaluated. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed to substitute variable names with their values. Returns object The result of the evaluation is returned as an object. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the expression is empty or if the evaluation process fails.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.FillCommand.html.title: Class FillCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.FillCommand.html.summary: Class FillCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The FillCommand class is implemented to control the fill state of shapes drawn on the canvas. The fill status is toggled based on the provided argument, determining whether subsequent shapes are filled or outlined. public class FillCommand : ICommand Inheritance object FillCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to update the fill state of the drawing canvas. The argument is evaluated to determine if the fill mode should be enabled ("on") or disabled. The canvas configuration is then updated accordingly. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas where the fill setting is applied. variables Dictionary<string, object> The variable dictionary is passed but not utilized for this specific command. args string[] The command arguments are processed to extract the desired fill state.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.ICommand.html.title: Interface ICommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.ICommand.html.summary: Interface ICommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The ICommand interface is defined to establish a contract for all command implementations. A standardized Execute method is required, ensuring consistent execution across different command types within the interpreter. public interface ICommand Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed using the provided canvas and variable context. This method is called to perform the specific logic associated with the implementing command class. void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is targeted for rendering operations. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed for parameter evaluation and storage. args string[] The array of command arguments is processed to direct the command's behavior.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.IfControl.html.title: Class IfControl | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.IfControl.html.summary: Class IfControl Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The IfControl class is implemented to manage the state of 'if-else' blocks. The condition and the execution status of the branch are tracked. public class IfControl : ControlFlow Inheritance object ControlFlow IfControl Inherited Members ControlFlow.StartLine object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Properties Condition public string Condition { get; set; } Property Value string ExecutedBranch public bool ExecutedBranch { get; set; } Property Value bool

api/BOOSEInterpreter.IntCommand.html.title: Class IntCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.IntCommand.html.summary: Class IntCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The IntCommand class is implemented to facilitate the declaration and assignment of integer variables. Functionality is provided to parse variable declaration syntax and evaluate initial values if supplied. public class IntCommand : ICommand Inheritance object IntCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to declare a new integer variable. The argument list is validated, and if an assignment expression is present, it is evaluated and assigned to the variable. If no assignment is provided, the variable is initialized to zero. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method execution context. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of global variables is accessed to store the new integer variable. args string[] The command arguments are parsed to extract the variable name and optional initialization expression. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the syntax is invalid or if a required expression is missing.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.MethodDefinition.ht.title: Class MethodDefinition | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.MethodDefinition.ht.summary: Class MethodDefinition Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The MethodDefinition class is implemented to store the structure of user-defined methods. Information regarding parameters and the sequence of method body commands is maintained for execution. public class MethodDefinition Inheritance object MethodDefinition Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors MethodDefinition() A new instance of the MethodDefinition class is initialized. The parameter and body line lists are instantiated to prepare for method definition storage. public MethodDefinition() Properties BodyLines A list of strings representing the method body is maintained. Each string corresponds to a line of code to be executed when the method is invoked. public List<string> BodyLines { get; set; } Property Value List<string> Parameters A list of parameter names is stored to define the method signature. public List<string> Parameters { get; set; } Property Value List<string>

api/BOOSEInterpreter.MoveToCommand.html.title: Class MoveToCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.MoveToCommand.html.summary: Class MoveToCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The MoveToCommand class is implemented to handle the movement of the drawing pen. The pen position is updated to the specified coordinates without performing any drawing operation on the canvas. public class MoveToCommand : ICommand Inheritance object MoveToCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to update the pen's current position. The target coordinates are extracted from the arguments, evaluated, and applied to the canvas. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas where the pen position is updated. variables Dictionary<string, object> The variable dictionary is accessed to evaluate coordinate expressions. args string[] The command arguments are processed to determine the new x and y coordinates. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the required number of parameters is not provided.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.Parser.html.title: Class Parser | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.Parser.html.summary: Class Parser Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The Parser class is implemented to process and execute BOOSE scripts. Script commands are analyzed line by line, flow control statements are managed, and methods are defined and invoked. The parser interacts with the CommandFactory to instantiate commands and the DrawingCanvas to reflect visual outputs. public class Parser Inheritance object Parser Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors Parser(DrawingCanvas) A new instance of the Parser class is initialized. The canvas, variable storage, method storage, and command factory are set up for operation. public Parser(DrawingCanvas canvas) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The DrawingCanvas instance used for graphical output. Properties Methods A dictionary of method definitions is exposed to store and retrieve user-defined methods. public Dictionary<string, MethodDefinition> Methods { get; } Property Value Dictionary<string, MethodDefinition> Methods ExecuteLine(string, Dictionary<string, object>) A single line of code is executed. The command type is identified, arguments are parsed, and the appropriate command object is invoked. public void ExecuteLine(string line, Dictionary<string, object> variables) Parameters line string The line of code to be executed. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables available for the execution context. Exceptions BOOSEException Thrown if an unknown command is encountered. ExecuteMethodBodyBlock(string[], Dictionary<string, object>) A block of code representing a method body is executed. Each line in the block is processed sequentially within the provided local variable scope. public void ExecuteMethodBodyBlock(string[] bodyLines, Dictionary<string, object> localVariables) Parameters bodyLines string[] The array of strings representing the method body. localVariables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of local variables for the method execution. ParseProgram(string[]) A complete program provided as an array of strings is parsed and executed. The lines are iterated through, and control flow logic is applied to handle loops, conditionals, and method definitions. public void ParseProgram(string[] lines) Parameters lines string[] The array of script lines to be executed. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if a method definition is not properly closed with an 'end method' statement.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.PeekCommand.html.title: Class PeekCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.PeekCommand.html.summary: Class PeekCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The PeekCommand class is implemented to retrieve values from arrays and store them into variables. Support is provided for both one-dimensional and two-dimensional arrays of integer or real types. public class PeekCommand : ICommand Inheritance object PeekCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to read a value from a specified array index. The array name, target variable, and index coordinates are parsed from the arguments. The retrieved value is then assigned to the target variable within the global variable dictionary. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method but is not utilized for data retrieval. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed to locate the source array and store the retrieved value. args string[] The command arguments are processed to identify the target variable, source array, and indices. Exceptions ArgumentException An exception is thrown if the syntax is incorrect, the array is not found, or the array type is unsupported.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.PenColourCommand.ht.title: Class PenColourCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.PenColourCommand.ht.summary: Class PenColourCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The PenColourCommand class is implemented to update the pen colour used for drawing operations on the canvas. Colours are defined using RGB values provided as parameters. public class PenColourCommand : ICommand Inheritance object PenColourCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to change the current drawing colour of the pen. The arguments are parsed to extract red, green, and blue components, which are then evaluated and applied to the canvas. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas where the pen colour is updated. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed to evaluate colour component expressions. args string[] The command arguments are processed to determine the RGB values. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the required RGB parameters are missing or invalid.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.PokeCommand.html.title: Class PokeCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.PokeCommand.html.summary: Class PokeCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The PokeCommand class is implemented to assign values to specific elements within arrays. It supports updating values in both one-dimensional and two-dimensional arrays of integer or real types. public class PokeCommand : ICommand Inheritance object PokeCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to update a specific array element with a new value. The array name, index or coordinates, and the value to be stored are parsed from the command arguments. The target array is identified, and the value is assigned to the specified location. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method but is not utilized for array manipulation. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed to locate the array and evaluate any variable references. args string[] The command arguments are processed to determine the target array, indices, and the value to be saved. Exceptions ArgumentException An exception is thrown if the specified array is not found.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.RealCommand.html.title: Class RealCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.RealCommand.html.summary: Class RealCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The RealCommand class is implemented to handle the declaration and assignment of real (floating-point) variables. It provides functionality to parse variable declaration syntax and evaluate initial values if they are supplied. public class RealCommand : ICommand Inheritance object RealCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to declare a new real variable. The argument list is validated, and if an assignment expression is present, it is evaluated and assigned to the variable. If no assignment is provided, the variable is initialized to 0.0. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method execution context. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of global variables is accessed to store the new real variable. args string[] The command arguments are parsed to extract the variable name and optional initialization expression. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the syntax is invalid or if a required expression is missing.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.RectangleCommand.ht.title: Class RectangleCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.RectangleCommand.ht.summary: Class RectangleCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The RectangleCommand class is implemented to facilitate the drawing of rectangles on the canvas. It processes width and height arguments, evaluating expressions if provided, and invokes the rectangle drawing method on the canvas. public class RectangleCommand : ICommand Inheritance object RectangleCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to draw a rectangle with the specified dimensions. The arguments are parsed to extract the width and height, handling optional commas and spaces. The dimensions are evaluated against the current variables before the drawing operation is performed. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is targeted for the rectangle drawing operation. variables Dictionary<string, object> The variable dictionary is accessed to evaluate dimension expressions. args string[] The command arguments are processed to determine the width and height of the rectangle. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the incorrect number of parameters is provided.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.VarCommand.html.title: Class VarCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.VarCommand.html.summary: Class VarCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The VarCommand class is implemented to handle the assignment of values to existing variables. It parses the assignment expression, evaluates the result, and updates the variable's value in the shared state. public class VarCommand : ICommand Inheritance object VarCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to assign a new value to a specified variable. The variable name and the expression to be evaluated are extracted from the arguments. The expression is then processed, and the resulting value is stored in the variables dictionary. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas is passed to the method but is not directly used for variable assignment. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of global variables is accessed to update the value of the target variable. args string[] The command arguments are processed to identify the variable name and the expression for assignment. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if the assignment syntax is invalid or if no expression is provided.

The loop condition string is stored for re-evaluation. public class WhileControl : ControlFlow Inheritance object ControlFlow WhileControl Inherited Members ControlFlow.StartLine object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Properties Condition public string Condition { get; set; } Property Value string

api/BOOSEInterpreter.WriteCommand.html.title: Class WriteCommand | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.WriteCommand.html.summary: Class WriteCommand Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Assembly BOOSEapp.dll The WriteCommand class is implemented to display text or values on the drawing canvas. It processes arguments which may include text strings, variables, or expressions, and renders the result at the current pen position. public class WriteCommand : ICommand Inheritance object WriteCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(DrawingCanvas, Dictionary<string, object>, string[]) The command is executed to write text onto the canvas. The arguments are combined and the relevant expression part is extracted and evaluated. The result is then formatted as a string (handling double and integer types specifically) and passed to the canvas for rendering. public void Execute(DrawingCanvas canvas, Dictionary<string, object> variables, string[] args) Parameters canvas DrawingCanvas The drawing canvas where the text is displayed. variables Dictionary<string, object> The dictionary of variables is accessed to evaluate any expressions contained in the write command. args string[] The command arguments are processed to determine the content to be written. Exceptions BOOSEException An exception is thrown if no text or expression parameter is provided.

api/BOOSEInterpreter.html.title: Namespace BOOSEInterpreter | mysite
api/BOOSEInterpreter.html.summary: Namespace BOOSEInterpreter Classes ArrayCommand The ArrayCommand class is implemented to handle the creation and initialization of arrays. Support is provided for both integer and real number arrays, including single and multi-dimensional definitions. BOOSEException The BOOSEException class is implemented to handle application-specific errors within the BOOSE Interpreter. It is derived from the standard Exception class to provide custom error messages and handling. BaseCommand The BaseCommand abstract class is implemented to provide shared functionality across specific command implementations. A common expression evaluator and helper methods are exposed to derived classes to facilitate argument processing. BooleanCommand The BooleanCommand class is implemented to facilitate the creation and assignment of boolean variables. Logical expressions are evaluated, and the resulting truth values are stored within the application state for later use. CallCommand The CallCommand class is implemented to facilitate the invocation of user-defined methods. Parameters are parsed, evaluated, and passed to the method body for execution within a local variable scope. CastCommand The CastCommand class is implemented to handle variable type casting. Real number values are converted into integers and stored in destination variables. CircleCommand The CircleCommand class is implemented to facilitate the drawing of circles on the canvas. The radius expression is evaluated, and the corresponding drawing operation is invoked. CommandFactory The CommandFactory class is implemented to manage the creation and retrieval of command objects. The Factory design pattern is utilized to instantiate commands based on string identifiers, ensuring a decoupled architecture. The Singleton pattern is applied to ensure a single instance of the factory manages command generation throughout the application lifecycle. CommandHelper The CommandHelper class is implemented to provide utility methods for command execution. Common operations such as argument evaluation are centralized to ensure consistency and reduce code duplication. ControlFlow The ControlFlow abstract class is defined to serve as a base for all flow control structures. The starting line index of the control block is stored. DrawToCommand The DrawToCommand class is implemented to handle drawing lines to specific coordinates. The pen is moved from its current position to the specified target coordinates, creating a line on the canvas. DrawingCanvas The DrawingCanvas class is used to perform drawing operations on a bitmap surface. It extends the functionality of the BOOSE.Canvas class to support specific shapes and text rendering using GDI+. ExpressionEvaluator The ExpressionEvaluator class is implemented to process and evaluate mathematical and logical expressions. A DataTable is utilized for numerical computation, and custom logic is applied for string operations and boolean comparisons. FillCommand The FillCommand class is implemented to control the fill state of shapes drawn on the canvas. The fill status is toggled based on the provided argument, determining whether subsequent shapes are filled or outlined. ForControl The ForControl class is implemented to manage the state of 'for' loops. The loop variable, start, end, and step values are maintained. Form1 IfControl The IfControl class is implemented to manage the state of 'if-else' blocks. The condition and the execution status of the branch are tracked. IntCommand The IntCommand class is implemented to facilitate the declaration and assignment of integer variables. Functionality is provided to parse variable declaration syntax and evaluate initial values if supplied. MethodDefinition The MethodDefinition class is implemented to store the structure of user-defined methods. Information regarding parameters and the sequence of method body commands is maintained for execution. MoveToCommand The MoveToCommand class is implemented to handle the movement of the drawing pen. The pen position is updated to the specified coordinates without performing any drawing operation on the canvas. Parser The Parser class is implemented to process and execute BOOSE scripts. Script commands are analyzed line by line, flow control statements are managed, and methods are defined and invoked. The parser interacts with the CommandFactory to instantiate commands and the DrawingCanvas to reflect visual outputs. PeekCommand The PeekCommand class is implemented to retrieve values from arrays and store them into variables. Support is provided for both one-dimensional and two-dimensional arrays of integer or real types. PenColourCommand The PenColourCommand class is implemented to update the pen colour used for drawing operations on the canvas. Colours are defined using RGB values provided as parameters. PokeCommand The PokeCommand class is implemented to assign values to specific elements within arrays. It supports updating values in both one-dimensional and two-dimensional arrays of integer or real types. RealCommand The RealCommand class is implemented to handle the declaration and assignment of real (floating-point) variables. It provides functionality to parse variable declaration syntax and evaluate initial values if they are supplied. RectangleCommand The RectangleCommand class is implemented to facilitate the drawing of rectangles on the canvas. It processes width and height arguments, evaluating expressions if provided, and invokes the rectangle drawing method on the canvas. VarCommand The VarCommand class is implemented to handle the assignment of values to existing variables. It parses the assignment expression, evaluates the result, and updates the variable's value in the shared state. WhileControl The WhileControl class is implemented to manage the state of 'while' loops. The loop condition string is stored for re-evaluation. WriteCommand The WriteCommand class is implemented to display text or values on the drawing canvas. It processes arguments which may include text strings, variables, or expressions, and renders the result at the current pen position. Interfaces ICommand The ICommand interface is defined to establish a contract for all command implementations. A standardized Execute method is required, ensuring consistent execution across different command types within the interpreter.

index.html.title: BOOSE Interpreter Documentation | mysite
index.html.summary: BOOSE Interpreter Documentation Welcome to the BOOSE Interpreter project documentation. Overview The BOOSE Interpreter is the graphical programming language that allows users to create drawings through code commands. It has the features of a complete parser, command execution system, and GUI interface. Key Features Drawing Commands: moveto, drawto, circle, rect, pencolour, write Control Structures: while loops, for loops, if-else conditionals Variable Support: integers, real numbers, arrays Method Definitions: Create and call custom methods with parameters Expression Evaluation: Mathematical expressions and variable operations GUI Interface: Form-based interface with program window, output window, and run button Architecture Highlights The interpreter uses a central ExecuteBlock method to parse and execute BOOSE programs. It creates and runs ICommand objects through a CommandFactory using the Singleton and Factory design patterns. Core Components Parser: It reads the BOOSE code line by line and creates command objects CommandFactory: It creates the appropriate command objects (Factory Pattern) ICommand Interface: The all commands implement this interface (Strategy Pattern) ExpressionEvaluator: It handles the mathematical expressions and the variable resolution MethodDefinition: It stores and manages the custom method definitions Implementation Challenges Control Structures The loops (while, for) were implemented by searching for block end markers (endwhile, endif) and recursively calling the ExecuteBlock based on condition tested. Methods The method system recognizes the signatures (e.g., method draw(p)), saves lines to the MethodDefinition object, and then creates new variable scopes when called. The proper parameter parsing was critical to avoid index-out-of-bound errors. Expression Evaluation A dedicated ExpressionEvaluator class handles the expression resolution, separating the concerns from the main parser logic. Design Patterns Factory Pattern: CommandFactory creates the command objects based on user's input Singleton Pattern: It ensures single instance of the key components Strategy Pattern: ICommand interface allows the extensible command system Interface Segregation: The all commands implement ICommand for the consistency Repository GitHub Repository: ASE BOOSE Assignment Author Group 3 - Jay Chotaliya Advanced Software Engineering Course October 2025
